title: Wildflower Quiz
description: Explore the beauty of wildflowers! Can you identify these free-growing blooms found in meadows, forests, and roadsides?

questions.question: Which bright orange wildflower is commonly seen along North American roadsides and is also called "Ditch Lily"?
What wildflower is the state flower of California and blooms in brilliant orange across hillsides?
Which small blue wildflower's name means "forget me not" and symbolizes remembrance?
What wildflower has a composite flower head of yellow petals surrounding a dark brown or black center?
Which wildflower is associated with World War I remembrance and grows in red fields?
What common yellow wildflower produces a white, fluffy seed head that children love to blow?
Which purple wildflower is a favorite of monarch butterflies and grows in large clusters?
What springtime wildflower carpets woodland floors in white before trees fully leaf out?
Which tall wildflower has a spike of purple-blue flowers and is named after a part of a knight's armor?
What cheerful wildflower is actually an early spring bulb that blooms in purple, white, or yellow?
Which wildflower's name comes from the Old English word for "day's eye" because it opens with the sun?
What pink or white wildflower grows in clover-like patches and is an important food source for bees?
Which blue wildflower blankets Texas hills in spring and is the state flower?
What tall yellow wildflower was once falsely blamed for causing hay fever (ragweed is the actual cause)?
Which delicate woodland wildflower has nodding bell-shaped flowers and a sweet fragrance?
